stock.model

Interface IPortfolioManagerModel

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    PersistentPortfolioManagerModel
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PortfolioManagerModel

    public interface IPortfolioManagerModel
    This interface represents the model of this program. A IPortfolioManagerModel is a collection of portfolios of a user. It defines operations to create, add and view the contents of the portfolio.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addToPortfolio(java.lang.String portfolio, Strategy strategy)
      Applies a strategy of adding stocks to this portfolio.
      void createPortfolio(java.lang.String portfolioName)
      Creates an empty portfolio with the given name and adds it to its collection.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getContentsOn(java.lang.String name, java.time.LocalDateTime date)
      Returns the contents of a portfolio as information of the stocks within the portfolio.
      double getPortfolioCostBasis(java.lang.String portfolioName, java.time.LocalDateTime date)
      Returns the cost basis,i.e.
      double getPortfolioCurrentValue(java.lang.String portfolioName, java.time.LocalDateTime date)

    • Method Detail

      • createPortfolio

        void createPortfolio(java.lang.String portfolioName)
        Creates an empty portfolio with the given name and adds it to its collection. A portfolio name has to be unique hence duplicate names will result in error.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - the unique name for the portfolio.

      • addToPortfolio

        void addToPortfolio(java.lang.String portfolio,
                    Strategy strategy)
        Applies a strategy of adding stocks to this portfolio.
        Parameters:
        portfolio - the portfolio name on which the strategy will be applied.
        strategy - the strategy object that defines how stocks will be added.

      • getPortfolioCostBasis

        double getPortfolioCostBasis(java.lang.String portfolioName,
                             java.time.LocalDateTime date)
        Returns the cost basis,i.e. the buying cost of the portfolio.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - the name of the portfolio whose cost is to be determined.
        Returns:
        the total cost it took to buy all the stocks in this portfolio.

      • getPortfolioCurrentValue

        double getPortfolioCurrentValue(java.lang.String portfolioName,
                                java.time.LocalDateTime date)
        Returns the current standing value of the portfolio at the given datetime.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - the name of the portfolio whose cost is to be determined.
        date - the date on which the value of the portfolio is to be determined.
        Returns:
        the total cost of the portfolio as it is on this given date.

      • getContentsOn

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getContentsOn(java.lang.String name,
                                                                java.time.LocalDateTime date)
        Returns the contents of a portfolio as information of the stocks within the portfolio.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the portfolio whose contents are required.
        date - the date at which the contents are required.
        Returns:
        a map with key as ticker symbol and value as quantity of stocks.
